title: Stealthed players on same team can't see eachother in same raid group in stealth on battlegrounds.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
When two players are in same group you can see stealthed player just fine. But if you are in same raid group, like on AV, but in different party groups - you can only see eachother on close range via stealth detection. 

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Join Alterac Valley battleground
2. Find some rogue or other stealther class in your team but in different group
3. Observe  not being able to see him in distance while he is stealthed.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
While in same raid group on battlegrounds you should be able to see all stealthed friendly players no matter if they are in same party or not. Because of current implementation its hard for stealthed players to coordinate actions with each other, because only way they can see each other is on minimap. So in critical situations players may miscoordinate (for example going onto two different objectives, instead of one) or not approaching enemy at the same time. In other vmangos derived servers i saw that strategy implemented and it works great for improving teamplay.

title: /afk removes you from battleground instantly even in combat and under crowd control spells
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
If you use /afk on battlegound you get afk state and get teleported out of battleground right away. Even if you are in middle of fight and under crowd control spells of other players.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Get into any battleground
2. Start fight with other player, get "In combat status"
3. type /afk in chat
4. Observe being removed from battleground while still in combat.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Afk status should remove frome battleground only if you are not in combat. When you are in combat or under crowd control spells you should not be able to escape pvp by just typing /afk. 

In current situation players abuse such mechanics, for example they showup on AV, run for black lotus spawn, even if its on enemy side of map, and after they got it(or not) they simply /afk out of battleground, while under guards, enemy rogues stunlocks etc. Which is quite annoying for players who could get honorable kills but miss them just cause someone used /afk command. Also this mechanics sometiimes is abused by hardcore characters, which feel safe to join av and try to farm there, cause in case of any danger they can insta /afk away from bg while not being punished for that.

comments.body: Should be fixed in the next update.

title: Can teleport to battleground while in combat and under crowd control spells
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
When battleground queue procs, you can enter battleground from in combat state. Not only that, you can enter it while being under crowd control spells from mobs or from players.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Queue AV as horde for quick procs
2. Start combat with any npc or player
3. Press enter battleground
4. Observe being teleported to battleground

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Queue proc should not accept players entering battleground untill they are out of combat.
Because of current mechanics people abuse it world pvp situations, like teleporting out of combat/rogue cc from middle of enemy city to avoid being killed. Or do one-shot attacks in gadgedzan (and other neutral cities) and then immediately accepting battlegound proc for avoiding being punished by guards.

comments.body: This sounds like a remnant of the old system we had from before the UI battleground queuing addon. We'll have to check if any other BG tabard is affected.

It seems distract and kick are completely unrelated to these mobs using blink strangely.

On the PTR, I did see them use it right inbetween two consecurtive fireball casts, and also 0 distance, and there is no delay on the 2nd fireball.

On Vmangos, when they use it right after the first fireball, they often end up behind you, and also don't cast until 2 seconds later.

title: GetCurrentMapContinent return crazy big numbers while in instances.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
For example when you go inside of UBRS/LBRS GetCurrentMapContinent() return you value 17.
BRD gives you 14.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Use macro (or just in chat):
`/script DEFAULT_CHAT_FRAME:AddMessage("Continent id: ".. GetCurrentMapContinent());`
2. Go outside, touch some grass, use this macro, observe: 1 - for Kalimdor, 2 - Eastern Kingdoms as per [usuall values](https://wowwiki-archive.fandom.com/wiki/API_GetCurrentMapContinent)
3. Go inside BRD, use this macro. observe:
![╨╕╨╖╨╛╨▒╤Ç╨░╨╢╨╡╨╜╨╕╨╡](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/deca0c6a-1483-48e8-8cbd-28181cae66af)
value is 14.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Should return same value as for on which continent entrance to the dungeon is.

**Why it's important**
- Its not logical... Do we really have 17 continents.
- Also because of this a few vanilla addons from official twow [fandom wiki](https://turtle-wow.fandom.com/wiki/Addons) just refuse to work in instances, just to name a few:
    * [MonkeySpeed](https://github.com/for-wow/MonkeySpeed) - Adds a simple movable speedometer displaying speed as a percentage of run speed.
    * [NotesUNeed](https://github.com/rnorden/NotesUNeed) - Manager that allows you to track Friends, Ignores, Guild members, Quests, Items and generic notes
    * [Spy](https://github.com/laytya/Spy-vanilla) - Detects and alerts you to the presence of nearby enemy players.
    * All addons based on Astrolabe library (as Spy uses it for example).
 
All of this addons are okay with having unknown ids of zones and can handle it, but they weren't ready that vanilla universe will be expanded to have at least 17 known continents. So when you load up in dungeon you just see constant ongoing spam of errors from addons, which is really annoying. Although i fixed them for myself, i think it would be better to have general fix on server side to not have this problem in the first place.

Most likely the time values will need to be updated in the addon code, but the change probably has no effect on how they detect time remaining. This is controlled by the WoW API as follows:

https://wowwiki-archive.fandom.com/wiki/API_GetAuctionItemTimeLeft

**Returns**
```
timeleft
    a number between 1 and 4

    1
        short (less than 30 minutes)
    2
        medium (30 minutes - 2 hours)
    3
        long (2 - 12 hours)
    4
        very long (more than 12 hours)
```

In other words the addons would still display "Very Long" incorrectly as 12-24 hours like they do currently, and the text string would need to be changed in the addon code itself. No additional addon bugs are likely to be introduced with this change.

title: Partial and full resists are not applied correctly
body: **Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:** Partial resists, Hit cap and full resists are not working properly. Even in some cases where the character has above 60 spell penetration. 7 % melee hit or 3% spell hit. This is just the case for holy damage, which is absurd as in theory a player can have max 0 holy resistance in pvp at level 60 as there is no holy resistance. I can understand that a fictional 24 is added to ensure that people have their 3% spell hit for that purpose. So I can only imagine what other classes are experiencing right now. This is my first post so please correct me where I'm wrong and what I'm misunderstanding in this situation. **Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:** **Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:** So here is the deal in regards to partial resists, as of right now I'm mostly healing and I cannot confirm these things firsthand. However I have guildmates who are well overgeared in both pve and pvp cases and they experiencing an absurd amount of partial resists. Things like thunderfury fully or partially resisting more often than it should, mages with over 70 spell penetration in pvp getting double partial resist or full resists against green geared players. The most recent instance that was caught is death coil being fully resisted. It is a binary spell, and as such it can only hit or miss. Neither critical hits nor partial resists are possible. However items like storm gauntlets have a 100% proc chance and are added to your melee attack, so if your melee hit doesn't land ( dodged, parry, miss etc.). It won't be applied. I have never seen it resist, do partial or even miss. It can crit and is not modified by spellpower, only by spellcrit chance. However the target can be immune to the damage type, hence why a lost of paladin are using 2 sets of gloves for those cases.

Greetings,

The way LFT works and by the amount of dynamic data and the amount of messages it has to process, the expected behaviour of having near to zero leak is simply impossible. Even in the best case, you will always see memory being used for the string comparisons it has to do on the chat messages.

But more important is, to have clear testing here. Because it's not clear if all of this is the fault of LFT. Since LFT is using functions in its OnEvent script that are often overwritten by other addons it can be possible that other addons do the bad stuff here. I would at least suggest to disable **every** addon beside LFT and pfDebug and check the results again, just to be sure that no other addon's hook does bad memory calls.

*Edit: As a workaround, you might want to simply leave the LFT channel (`/leave LFT`), so it no longer processes any chat data*

title: Looking for turtles embedded addon leaks memory
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
LFT addon which is embedded into twow client leaks memory even when not actively used for party search.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Install [pfDebug](https://github.com/shagu/pfDebug) addon from shagu for memory consumption visualisation
2. Run twow original client with pfDebug addon enabled.
3. Right-Click on the Frame to open the Analyzer
4. Press Scan button on alanyzer
5. After Scan become active, close window with X on it.
6. Play some game without using LFT in any way. Just kill some mobs in location.
7. Try to play some more, but have at least 1 party member with you. (This was condition in which i observed this issue, but i don't know for sure if it is required condition to reproduce bug.
8. I suppose effect will be more present it large online numbers on server, cause more events will happen.
9. Open up Analyzer again and observe results like so: ![╨í╨╜╨╕╨╝╨╛╨║ ╤ì╨║╤Ç╨░╨╜╨░ (17601)](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/731db62c-10ba-4141-9801-4be624d12e45)

## Expected behavior
1. Expected to have around zero leak value for such permanent addition to the game.
2. As a workaround if 1st variant is not possible for some reason, expected to have toggle switch as for other addons to permanently disable this addon for times i dont look for party. (Or please post how i can disable it right now, if silly me just didnt saw that option available).

## Why its important
I play on old pc in which any lags are more noticible than more modern pcs. When any of addons leaks (uses in unreasonable way alot of memory) it makes garbage collector of game to run more frequently removing memory which were allocated by addon and actually already not used. Each garbage collection for me represents like 1-4 seconds freeze of game, which can be quite annoying in pve/raiding situation and brutaly horrifying in pvp situations. Especially its concerning cause this happens no matter what. And i dont have way to disable this addon, while i dont need this functionallity at all.

title: Triskelion of Roving Elements speed bonus doesnt stack with boots minor speed increase bonus
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
 [Triskelion of Roving Elements](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=60860) speed bonus doesnt stack with [boots minor speed increase](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=13890) bonus.
 
**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Download and install [MonkeySpeed](https://github.com/for-wow/MonkeySpeed) for speed measurement
2. Start running at normal speed (no speed modifiers)
3. Enter the command /mscalibrate to calibrate the speed.
4. Observe addon showing 100 as we run forward (thanks to Zorg for providing test results!)
![╨╕╨╖╨╛╨▒╤Ç╨░╨╢╨╡╨╜╨╕╨╡](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/64664e19-f421-40ff-9922-f39071fbe483)
5. Put on any boots with ["Enchant Boots - Minor Speed"](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=13890) on them. Start running forward, observe speed equal to 108: 
![╨╕╨╖╨╛╨▒╤Ç╨░╨╢╨╡╨╜╨╕╨╡](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/ba6a010c-b284-427d-a1c2-27f5d54be9df)
6. Put on  [Triskelion of Roving Elements](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=60860)  into trinket slot. Start running forward, observe speed still equal to 108.
![╨╕╨╖╨╛╨▒╤Ç╨░╨╢╨╡╨╜╨╕╨╡](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/95504a5b-a68e-4a8b-b73c-bf97302493c8)
7. If you remove  speed boots, you still get 108 speed value.
![╨╕╨╖╨╛╨▒╤Ç╨░╨╢╨╡╨╜╨╕╨╡](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/676c3060-dbcd-489f-b5b3-9e54c438b723)

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

Item:  [Triskelion of Roving Elements](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=60860) 
Quest: [An Honorary Gelkis](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40629)
Spell: [Enchant Boots - Minor Speed](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=13890)

## How it should work
1. When both boots and trinket are put on you should get sum of their bonuses, so 116 value.

## Motivation for that change
1. As i saw after openning issue it actually related to #5126, but i think twow is about vanilla + experience. If i remember correctly some time ago + mounted speed bonuses didnt stack in the past, for 2 trinkets, but they do now. Also we got more speed boosts for mounted players - like mithrill spurs vs thorium spurs, i think its time to go to original design of this item, i didnt find any complains of people about this item being too op or somehow bad for community.
2. Also it would be coherent behavior with other speed increasing trinkets, for example - mount speed increase trinkets. If you put on gloves enchants + thorium spurs + carrot trinket + goblin car key trinket - they all stack up and give sum bonus to speed.
3. Even for increase swim speed bonus it works same way, if you put on Azure Slik Belt and Murlock's Flippers which also have + swim speed bonus, this values stack and you swim with speed equal to 100+ both of their bonuses.
4.  Everyone loves speed, it would make this item truly great trinket and balance out current meta around Gelkis vs Magram.
5. Simmilar quest with Magrams provides Dyad of Twitching Elven Ears which is great for stealth users, it would be fair if Gelkis allies also get something usefull - trinket that stacks speed with boots would be realy good for stealth users which would provide additionaly speed for their stealth movement. Giving both questlines usefullness parity.
6. It wouldn't affect pvp or pve balance that much but would really increase value of item and motivation of players to participate in this questline. 
7. Alot of buffs and effects are present in game already which increase movement speed for greater values. Think of [Swiftness of Zanza](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=23796) for example. So even with stacked bonus player will have running speed increased less then Zanza provides.
8. This quest item is available for both factions in any given moment, so it doesn't discriminate agains any group of players.
9. Literaly in description of item it says that it does "Minor increase to running and swimming speed" which player with boots enchant just doesnt observe at all. Imagine dissapointment of player who farmed so much reputation, did all quests, choose this trinket and saw its basically not working.

## Additional thought 
It would be great if devs can also check if Dyad of Twitching Elven Ears + stealth detection bonus stacks with all other + stealth detection bonuses, cause if it is not - it should be.

# Is it that bad?

I asked myself the same question and decided to check some stats on games. 
I analyzed last 260 av games that i participated in during the period from 07-13-2023 till 02-25-2024. I manually removed all the games that finished prematurely due to lack of players. And analyzed colors of final bg screen for the results of match.

Take this stats with grain of salt cause it's only my timezone and i didn't participated in all possible games. But it displays some of player experience on server. 
Only 40 games are presented in gif because of github size restrictions. Which color is more present: the blue or the red one?
![av](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/04084686-e02e-4d9a-a1c4-ef25ec65c40f)

So what did we learn from the stats you ask?
Here is the plot of horde vs alliance wins over all analyzed games:
![Figure_1](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/6ac0bd8a-497a-4e67-bd1c-7bcda50c7e9b)

## In total
Alliance wins: **165**
Horde wins: **95**
So horde wins only in **36.53%** of cases while alliance wins **63.47%** of games.

In simple terms you are likely to **lose** at least **2 games** as horde to **win one** game.
I was lucky enough to get in av with horde premades, which provided a few streaks of horde winning over alliance. But this luxury isnt available for all horde players participating in this battle ground. So average win rate can be even lower than my personal experience.

Speaking of experience, turtle wow is all about it. And what can affect it more than lose streak? So i calculated longest win streaks and lose streaks in this 260 games. Longest win streak for **alliance is 19 games in a row**! And longest win streak for **horde is only 9 games in a row**. Now imagine playing horde and participating in av while losing AV 19 times in a row! Even if you play 5 AV per day is **_4 days of losing without winning_**. You would think AV just cant be win by horde by this time.

I think this numbers suggest the need of balance changes on av. It can be done in different ways. But map rebalance is the easiest to implement, doesn't affect other gameplay mechanics such as pve and helps to avoid upsetting certain classes with nerfs.

So this issue were noticed by players on forums, discord, ingame chats and now here on github. I'm suggesting dev team finally look into this matter. 

I want to notice that this fixes arent something terribly new to begin with. First of all suggested fixes were implemented in older av map before av rework although this map had other backdoor jumps issues. So rework fixed old backdoor jumps but introduced new one for horde side only.

Also there were fast and effective fixes of map already implemented by dev team after my issue [here](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4114) for alliance side. Now its time for horde side!


# So how palas should do it tho?
Here you go, full sequence, as I have promised! (Credit for video goes to [Tendies](https://forum.turtle-wow.org/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=72708))

https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/16599015/8920bb05-8c86-457a-8cee-734fe66f8f5d

# Whats wrong with it?

1. It skips all bottom half of base by just going over the fence
2. While mounted you lose melee npc aggro right around tower so you good to go now...
3. Archers from both towers are in los position while you stand behind tower/fence so you are not attacked by any archers.
6. When running forward into base - there is no nps that will aggro up to flag itself
7. You dont need any cooldowns used for this to work, no need for bubble, nothing
8. Additionally this fence cant be penetrated by ranged attacks or by melee hits, so even when players are recalling to defend - they can attack alliance cause they just hide behind fence/tree making choke point defence untill they gather high enough number of players to do final blow.

So in total we get unlimited supply of people streaming down this "pipe" not getting damaged by npcs, not getting combat status and having place to gather critical mass (like 7 of them in picture above) when recalling will be not effective after they get hut flag.

Also it opens drednaught tank classes ways to solo cap hut. They just run mounted whole route, and after that kill everything on flag - kiting elite and capping flag in the end.

Because of this exploit on map 8 of 10 games finish into alliance winning just because horde base is open to be ambushed by any amount of alliance players without any slowing down factos. While horde will struggle to cross over bridge getting spammed by archers and other npcs.

Because of this exploit alot of good pvp players just refuse to recall and defend base, cause they see how outnumbered they are each time.

# Suggestions

1. Add same invisible wall as were added to alliance side after [this issue](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4114) at tower part of backdoor route. So when people try to cross tower wall part they just slide downhill. This will be even less intrusive than on alliance side where you can observe invisible wall preventing you from casting to people.

title: Unable to finish the "Making a Statement" quest
body:
Hello,
I have a problem with the "Making a Statement" quest. I'm supposed to hand in the head of that dwarf spy to Baron Revilgaz, become hated by Booty Bay and turn the quest in to "the fox", a Bloodsail Buccaneer spy.
Problem is, after handing in the head of the dwarf and Booty Bay becoming hostile to me, I just checked and am still "hated" with the Bloodsail Buccaneer faction.
Isn't this quest supposed to bump my Bloodsail rep to Neutral at least? I'm now hated by both. That makes no sense.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Accept the quest "Making a Statement" in Booty Bay.
2. Talk to Baron Revilgaz and select the dialogue option where you hand in the dwarf's head (there's only one).
3. You're now hated with Booty Bay. Problem : If you're hated with the Bloodsail Buccaneers, you're now hated with both.


**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: 
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=60453 (Garfield Sparkblast <The Fox>)
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=2496 (Baron Revilgaz)
Quest: 
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40180 (Making a Statement)

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Losing all rep with Booty Bay, especially in such a gore action against them, should automatically reward you with the appropriate amount of rep -neutral- with the opposite faction (Bloodsail Buccaneers) so as to be able to turn the quest in to Sparkblast. 
It makes no sense I was able to accept the quest in the first place if he won't talk to me in his boat afterwards.

Edit : after further investigation on how to increase the Bloodsail Buccaneers rep, it appears only one farm is available without getting wrecked by the 60 elites bruisers in booty bay, Faldir's Cove. Yet even this farm, which appears very tedious on retail ( you can only get 5 rep per Booty Bay npc killed there ), is bugged on Turtle.
 Shakes O'Breen, the ship's captain in Faldir's Cove, is supposed to have a 5-30 seconds respawn to compensate for the low rep gain (both factions are used in the "Insane in the Membrane" achievement on retail ). On Turtle it's 5 mins like any other NPC, which makes grinding from hated to neutral utterly impossible.

comments.body: This happens when your game loads too slow. There's nothing really that can be done from our end. Check for help on improving loading times, moving to SSD...

> This happens when your game loads too slow. There's nothing really that can be done from our end. Check for help on improving loading times, moving to SSD...

Spitballing a solution here:

1. When player leaves zone check if they are on a transport, assign transport ID to player
2. When player enters zone check if they have a transport ID, if they are X distance away from transport teleport them to transport
3. Clear transport ID

This would provide a solution for when you spawn in too late and the transport is already ahead of you. I've noticed sometimes I spawn on top of the transport as normal but still fall down. You could repeat that transport distance/teleport check for a short period of time to catch that case as well. I don't imagine too many people are intentionally jumping off transports within a second or two of zoning in. Alternatively instead of distance you could check if the player is falling.

title: Unlearned armorsmithing by choosing to be an armorsmith
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

So I'll start out by saying I've been a maxed out 300/300 armorsmith for a few months now and have accumulated quite a few armorsmithing only schematics. A friend asked my to craft him some thorium spurs so I went to the anvil in orgrimmar to craft them. I accidently right clicked on Krathok Moltenfist, who is near the anvil, and at the bottom of his text window there was a option to click/choose something along the lines of "I wish to be an armorsmith". Me already being an armorsmith, having done the quest previously, clicked on it to see what would happen.  

I was stripped of my blacksmithing/armorsmithing knowledge but then immediately relearned the professions(armorsmithing and blacksmithing). Unfortunately, every single schematic I learned from the trainers is now gone, and every single schematic that was armorsmithing specific is now gone from my list as well. The only schematics I appear to still have now are the ones that I learned that were not learned from a trainer nor was armorsmithing specific.  This is very unfortunate since I previously had some very rare and also some very expensive armorsmithing schematics.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Already be a blacksmith and armorsmith
2.  Talk to Krathok Moltenfist
3. Choose the " I wish to be an armorsmith" option -- I'm paraphrasing since I don't remember exactly what the line was

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=11176
Item: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=
Object: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?object=

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

IF someone is already an armorsmith, when someone talks to Krathok Moltenfist and chooses "I wish to be an armorsmith" option, nothing should happen. Even better, if someone is already an armorsmith, the option shouldn't even be there. If this is an intentional mechanic for non armorsmiths, you'd think there would be a warning after saying that all your skills will be wiped. I had no way of knowing this would happen.  

When you even talk to Krathok Moltenfist he even says in his text "Be warned, <adventurer>. Once the choice is made and the tasks required is completed - there is no going back. One can only walk down one path.".

title: City Gift Collection Buffs from the Love Is in the Air Event shouldn't stack with each other or with Blasted Lands/Zanza Buffs
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The City Gift Collection buffs from the Love Is in the Air event shouldn't stack with each other or with Blasted Lands/Zanza consumable buffs.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Create the following items: Darnassus/Ironforge/Orgrimmar/Stormwind/Thunder Bluff/Undercity Gift Collection.
2. Creating all of them at once will grant you a total of +60 Agility, +60 Intellect and +60 Stamina for 60 minutes.
3. Add other consumable buffs on top of this like the Blasted Lands buffs and a Zanza and you will have even more buffs that all stack. This can be game-breakingly overpowered and can be stacked infinitely on alts as the items aren't soulbound.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Alliance Gift Collection (has links to all of the items that buff you when created): https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=22262#created-by
Horde Gift Collection = https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=22263#created-by

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
The City Gift Collection buffs shouldn't stack with each other and they shouldn't stack with other items like Blasted Lands consumables and Zanza.

This video tells us so: https://youtu.be/Mm5MwDTfprM?si=3VA6B2R6fCdK9Uj_&t=72

At 1:12 into the video: "They do not stack with Blasted Lands buffs or Zanza."

Another proof is [this Wowhead comment from 2006](https://www.wowhead.com/classic/item=22262/alliance-gift-collection#comments:id=2684634) telling us that the The City Gift Collection buffs should not stack with each other: "NOTE, when I combined my Darnassus packet, the +agility buff removed the +intell buff that was there, so I'm thinking only one buff active at a time."

More Wowhead Classic comments saying that they don't stack with other collection buffs or with Blasted Lands/Zanza buffs:

https://www.wowhead.com/classic/item=22133/darnassus-gift-collection#comments:id=2648694

https://www.wowhead.com/classic/item=22133/darnassus-gift-collection#comments:id=3189895:reply=1355048

comments.body: Mailbox contents do not last longer than a month. Please contact support.

Possible explanation:
If you keep mail in your inbox for longer than than 30 days without looking inside it is returned to the sender (from whose mailbox it will permanently deleted if he also doesn't open it for another 30 days).
If you DO look inside (but do not loot it) the timer will go down to 3 days. After which the mail will disappear from your inbox but is not returned to the sender until the full 30 days have passed.
I've previously thought I had lost mail this way after sending it between bank alts because it wasn't present in either mailbox only to miraculously reappear in the sender inbox after the 30 days after original sending had passed.

That might mean the mail is invisible in the recipients mailbox but still taking up slots counting toward the inbox limit.
Now if this is blizzlike or not I do not know.

It looks like this was perhaps a dialogue issue? That it was meant for you to return to Chromie and not Kheyna.

This quest is working as intended. This is a typical intentional (for narrative purposes) misdirection of the player by sending them to the last place they spoke to the NPC, only for the NPC to be dead, or for another NPC to take their place, or some unforeseen event to happen.

This is only a problem if you cannot turn in the quest, regardless if the Objective says to "Return to X" and you instead "Return to Y". title: Major balance druid bug?
body:
I believe there is either a bug with nature's grace or a combination of Improved wrath and improved starfire.  The UI shows your bar as a cast time of 1.5 seconds on wrath but using stop watch time trials and video review every cast is 2 seconds when it should be 1.5 seconds with wrath. AND starfire is casting at 3.5 seconds when it should be casting at 3 seconds with improved starfire.

I started figuring this out while doing 5 time trials of each wrath and starfire.  I began thinking that the problem was nature's grace not actually giving you the speed. I found my actual average cast time of wrath to be 1.65-1.76 seconds depending on numbers of crit. and expected time was 1.32-1.43seconds average cast time based on crits. Similar problem with starfire with an average actual cast time of 3.21-3.24 seconds per cast despite 17.6-18.8% crits.  Trial data attached.

There is a small chance that the system is actually registering 2 second normal cast on wrath and 1 second following a crit. As well, 3.5 second regular starfire followed by 2.5 second starfire after crit. If you enter these values into my trial the expected and actual are within 2-3% of expected total cast time on a trial of ~30 spells. 

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Login to your test server on a balance druid with talents : https://talents.turtle-wow.org/druid/V0X08Z9V-0-U5D6
2. Run a third party clock and a DPS meter that logs crits, hits and misses.
3. Cast 40-100 spells per trial
4. compare your total expected time and your actual recorded time.  (there is likely a lag that can attribute to a small maybe 0.1 second difference average)

![Starfire Spam Trial](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/157998650/e7b2551e-d639-4bba-a999-321e286be74d)
![Wrath Spam Trial](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/157998650/e0c0c7fa-2817-42e7-a7d3-37f99f5687f0)

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

100% crit with wrath should experience a near 1s cast time consistently
25% crit with wrath should expect an average cast time of 1.37s 
0% crit should experience an average cast time of 1.5 s

If nature's grace cannot function due to 1.12 server limitations as some druids believe. Simple change the talent to (next wrath does 50% more damage or your next starfire does 20% more damage)
If there is a bug isolated to improved wrath and improved starfire, please resolve.

title: Many mobs and bosses in Dire Maul West have been made poison immune, making the dungeon frustrating for rogue tanks
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
In the recent immunity update (or at some other recent point in time), many of the mobs and bosses in Dire Maul West have been updated to be immune to poison damage. While this might be flavorful and vanilla-accurate, it makes tanking the dungeon as a rogue extremely difficult, as the primary threat source of Agitating Poison is completely nullified.

While for a DPS rogue the lack of poison procs is simply a DPS reduction, for a tank rogue it severely cuts threat generation to the point of being unable to tank properly. I do not think it's particularly fun gameplay to have some instances one simply can not (comfortably) tank, regardless of gear level.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Enter Dire Maul West as a rogue, with poisons on weapons (Agitating Poison as tank)
2. Fight mobs and bosses
3. Observe the majority of them being immune to poisons. Treants, mana elementals, whirlwind elementals, to name a few mob types.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
No mob should be made completely immune to a specific tank class. If you wish to retain the poison immunity for flavor reasons, Agitating Poison should perhaps be made to deal its bonus threat effect even on nature immune targets.

title: Theorized bug with natural weapons talent - druid
body:
Theorized bug with natural weapons talent - druid :::

I theorize that there is a bug affecting the + spell hit with druid ability Natural Weapons talent and if not, then possibly with one or more gear pieces listed below. I have run DPSmate for tracking and our guild runs an independent logging program that records everyoneΓÇÖs damage as well. Both recordings show the same miss rate on boss encounters from our AQ40 raid. IΓÇÖve also been reviewing logs from BWL from DPSmate of my own spells, warlocks, and mages.

Total 6% hit + 3% spell hit from talent Natural Weapons talent. Bosses are to have 17% miss which can be overcome up to 16% hit cap. I should be missing about 7-8%. In raids over all bosses, I am missing 10.3-11.8% between both Starfire and wrath on tests over 100s of hits. This is also reflective of some boss target dummy runs as well.

I since recorded another BWL run with an average of 10.8% miss on bosses. In this run I received Neltharion's tear (2% hit tricket) and I ran an Onyxia after. My now total is 8% hit + 3% spell hit from natural weapons talent = +11% hit. On Onyxia I missed 8.5% now (about 2% less miss now). This is still far off from the expected 5-6% hit.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1.Login to your test server on a balance druid with talents : https://talents.turtle-wow.org/druid/V0X08Z9V-0-U5D6
2. Put on this gear

- 5 pc Genesis (+3% hit)
- Choker of the fire lord
- Cloak of consumption (+1% hit)
- Bracers of accuracy (+1% hit)
- gloves of spell mastery
- Mana igniting cord
- dragonslayerΓÇÖs signet
- Band of forced concentration (1% hit)
- Corrupt reed
- Eye of the beast
- Staff of shadowflame

4. Become immortal
5. Shoot BWL or AQ40 bosses - 100+ times with each starfire and wrath.
6. Review logs

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

I have reviewed logs of my guilds mages, and they see 0-0.7% miss in raid. They do have 6% + hit in talent and more hit gear, but they are +15% hit with talents and gear combined.  I reviewed logs with a destruction warlock in my guild and he has +9% hit and our logs showed him at 5.5% miss.

Conclusion: I think the most likely reason for my significantly elevated miss is Natural weapon talent may not be functioning for spell hit. 

** Further comments **

If a question is raised about spell resist and penetration, all bosses in AQ40 and BWL (except Chromaggus) according to your data based have 15 spell resist to nature and Arcane. Further I have 40 spell penetration in my set. It is rumored that the twow engine cannot overcome the last 15 resist and caps at 15 and not zero even with spell pen. I cannot confirm this. At 15 spell resistance (if it is not capable of being reduced to zero) I donΓÇÖt believe it has even 1% chance of a full resist. I believe it technically can only 25%,50%, or 75% resist.

title: Corrupted Dream Shard quest item drops for everyone in a raid.
body:
Repeatable quest 'Corrupted Dream Shards' in Hyjal rewards a Bright Dream Shard for delivered 5 quest items 'Corrupt Dream Shard'.
'Corrupt Dream Shard' drop is shared for entire group/raid - everyone gets a copy of quest item and hence it is very easy to farm money with a group. title: Regrowth healing coefficient not accurate
body:
I have done several tests with regrowth and find that the abilities have the incorrect healing power coefficient for HoT at exactly 7% per tick where as in classic wow had regrowth coefficient was 9.09%. If this value is incorrect it may also affect ability swift mend when consuming the HoT.

Classic wow formula for a calculating any heal. Below values are for regrowth:
Regrowth Direct: ```(2/3.5)*(2/3.5) / (2/3.5 + 15/15) = 18.65%```
Regrowth HoT: ```(15/15)*(15/15) / (2/3.5 + 15/15) = 63.63% (9,09% per tick) (7)```

Abilities have been tested on rank 7, 8, and 9 and all have 7% ticks.

To reproduce:
1. See spell tool tip for rank's base healing over time (example rank 7 : 861 over 21 seconds = 123 heal per 3 seconds (7 ticks)
2. Equip a given level of healing value. My example was 513 healing. Which should calculate as: 513 healing power * 0.0909 = 46.63 per tick = 169.6 (rounds to 170) per tick. However actual test results in 159 healing which is to say 513 healing power *0.07 + 123 = 158.9 (159 rounding)
3. Test with other ranks 7, 8, 9 and found all ranks have the same 7% coefficient. 
4. Formulas for Rejuvenation seem accurate at 20% coefficient per tick

title: Lunar Festival Reputation rewards
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Met up with a Lunar Festival elder, received a coin of ancestry and the reputation reward:
Part of the reward is a, what I assume to be, faction-wide reputation gain: 50 alliance reputation with 10(?) to Stormwind, Ironforge, Gnomeregan exiles and Darnassus. But no Silvermoon Remnants reputation reward. The same should be true for Horde rewards - no Revantusk reputation is gained. I was at 2112/6000 reputation with Silvermoon Remnant before turn-in and have that same number after the turn-in. My character was a human so they gain extra reputation due to diplomacy racial, the numbers indicated were 55 alliance and 13 Stormwind/Ironforge/Gnomeregan/Darnassus, so it might be double-dipping by first increasing Alliance 50 -> 55, then if it's 20% of that 55 to be 11 for the subfactions, that also get multiplied by 1.1 to then be 12.1 rounded up to 13 for humans?

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Chinese New Year / Lunar Festival event
2. Talk to a festival elder with a quest that you haven't yet collected and turn it in
3.  Gain rewards.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC:
Elder Bladeswift
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=15598
There are a lot more Lunar Festival elders, but listing them all individually is fairly pointless.

Quest: 
Bladeswift the Elder
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=8718
Each of the elders have their own turn-in quest with its own data entry, listing them all seems fairly pointless.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
It is debatable what the intent of the reputation reward for the event is. Classic/Vanilla didn't have the custom reputation factions: Silvermoon Remnants and Revantusk Trolls. But to me, gaining an Alliance or Horde reputation should indicate reputation gain to all the subfactions that it comprises of and this should include the Silvermoon and Revantusk factions, but for some reason, it has not been made so. This leads me to believe that this deep into the game's life cycle, a decision has probably been made to not include them for some reason, not sure if it's due to vanilla/classic having not included those, so therefore neither should TWoW, or if there is some other reasoning behind it. However, for all intents and purposes, this looks like a bug, so I am reporting it, even if it may very well be working as intended. Other sources that give faction-wide reputation (Alliance or Horde) are probably equally bugged with regards to not giving Silvermoon or Revantusk reputations. If you add these factions to the Alliance reputation and Horde reputation code, it should be a blanket fix for all individual 'bugged' reputation rewards out there, probably.

title: Scholomance "Spectral Tutor" casting "Image Projection" While Shackled
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Using "shackle undead" on "Spectral Tutor" (from Scholomance) does not freeze it completely. The monster is still able to use its "image projection" ability, which summons its copies and then attacks players with its copies, while the original monster still remains shackled in place.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Use the priest spell "shackle undead" on "Spectral Tutor".
2. Stay near the "Spectral Tutor". You don't need to be right next to it, but a couple meters away works too.
3. Very soon, the "Spectral Tutor" will perform its "image projection" ability while it is still shackled.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
I think if the "Spectral Tutor" is successfully shackled, then it should not be able to cast the "Image Projection". I never played 2006 wow though, so I'm just basing this on clues from elsewhere.

Below is an old video on youtube from 2006 wow.
https://youtu.be/72YMHv00QT4?si=Ygkow4NhvgL8gKbp&t=152

At 2:32 seconds, it shows a "Spectral Tutor" being shackled, and the priest somehow being just fine standing right beside it. Unfortunately, the video cuts off very often, so I can't see how the rest of the fight ends. This leads me to think that the "Spectral Tutor" does not "split" while shackled.

Also, Zaas (from Discord) says this is "100% a bug".

body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

title: Princess Theradras in Maraudon - unique loot - working as intended?
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Killed Princess in Maraudon. She dropped Blackstone Ring. Was unable to pick it up, because it is treated as 'unique' and I already owned one. Should it be unique-equipped instead, because I'd imagine that people would still wish to vendor it even if they loot a duplicate one? Now it's only useful as duplicate if you can disenchant the one you already carry and replace it with the fresh one - provided that you are not in a group where someone else can loot it.


**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Kill Princess and loot her Blackstone Ring
2. Kill Princess again, see her drop another Blackstone Ring
3.  Be unable to pick up the ring, since it is unique instead of unique-equipped

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
NPC: 
Princess Theradras
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=12201

Item:
Blackstone Ring
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=17713

By extension her other 'unique' drop is: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=17780
It didn't look like anything else in her drop pool was unique.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
It seems awfully artificial that the reality prevents your hero from looting a ring from an enemy they slay, because they happen to already have one, either on their person or in their bank. There's a category of equipment known as 'unique-equipped', which means you can only wear one of them, even if you are able to own multiple ones, you tend to see it in rings, trinkets, and one-handed weapons - basically in gear that you have multiple slots it is eligible for. To be fair, I can't recall if unique-equipped was added later on, and maybe wasn't there in vanilla... Doing a quick look on wowhead, it looks like there are total of 25 unique-equipped items in classic, and 414 in TBC, so it was probably added later on in the dev cycle nearing the end of vanilla, maybe? In fact, looking at the TBC version of Blackstone ring, it has been changed to unique-equipped from unique.

So, I'm not sure if this could be regarded as a bug or working as intended. There are certainly arguments for either case. Mainly, that it should stay as unique because it was unique in vanilla and only changed in TBC. On the other hand, TBC rectified some mistakes (bugs/overlooked issues etc) that were present in vanilla, and changing it to unique-equipped could have been a change made because players discovered that if they own the ring, they cannot loot it again, adding a 'worthless' drop to Princess's drop pool if they didn't have the ability to disenchant it on the fly. I would argue that unique treasures should probably be made unique-equipped instead for the most part, simply because of how horrible it feels if you have to leave the treasure behind because of such a limitation. They are bind on pickup gear from dungeon bosses, so you can't really get them to a player character who wasn't there to loot it when the boss was killed, so vendoring and disenchanting seem to be the most common solutions to deal with soulbound unique-equipped items you can't wear.

5. Receive a sleep effect from High Inquisitor Whitemane.
6. As High Inquisitor Whitemane is casting Scarlet Resurrection, the stun effect will somehow be broken and you will be able to attack her. 
7. Attack High Inquisitor Whitemane while she is casting Scarlet Resurrection (this step might be unnecessary).

title: Vial of Potent Venoms - Debuff not applying correctly.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The poison debuff from the Vial of Potent Venoms apparently can stack up to 5 times according to the tooltip. However, the debuff never goes above 2 stacks. Also, the damage is not correlating to the tooltip information. The tooltip says it "**deals 100 Nature damage over 12 secs. Stacks up to 5 times.**". The damage ticks every 3 seconds which means the first stack should be doing 4 ticks of 25 damage (100, in total). The second stack should be doing 4 ticks of 50 damage (200, in total). However, in reality, the 1st and 2nd stacks are ticking for 30 and 60 damage, respectively.


**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Druid (feral form) with nothing equipped except for Vial of Potent Venoms.
2. Attack a Stormwind Expert or Apprentice Training Dummy for a sustained period of time (e.g. 10+ minutes).
3. The debuff will never exceed 2 stacks even though you can hear the sound effect suggesting that another dose of poison has been applied.


**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Expert Training Dummy - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=50516
Apprentice Training Dummy - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=50515
Vial of Potent Venoms (ID - 61243) - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=61243


**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
At one stack, I expect the damage-over-time effect to tick for 25, four times (100, in total).
At two stacks, I expect the damage-over-time effect to tick for 50, four times (200, in total).
At three stacks, I expect the damage-over-time effect to tick for 75, four times (300, in total).
At four stacks, I expect the damage-over-time effect to tick for 100, four times (400, in total).
At five stacks, I expect the damage-over-time effect to tick for 125, four times (500, in total).

I've tested this using my druid (feral form) for about 30 minutes on a Stormwind expert/apprentice training dummy and the proc rate is around 20%. Combine this with the fast attack speed of cat form (~1 attack per second), it is quite likely to to get another proc without the damage-over-time effect falling off. Therefore, I would reliably expect to reach five stacks and be able to maintain it for very long periods of time.

title: A living druid after death
body:
1. While in bear form, activate the berserk ability.
2. When health is low and the berserk ability expires, press exit from the bear form.
3. You will get a dead character who cannot move or use abilities, but is still being attacked by enemies.
4. Aggro is retained, which can be used in raids if desired and skillful.
5. All buffs on the character are saved.
6. The character's mana has been restored.
7. It was possible to change weapons.

**The druid "berserk" ability in the feral talent branch is not in the classic version of the game, which is probably why I couldn't find a reference to it on your site.

body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
[Barkskin Pendant](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=61442) and maybe more can be looted from [Barkskin furbolgs](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=61442#dropped-by) at Barkskin Village in Hyjal with no [Barkskin Vengeance](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40893) quest in quest log.

![Untitled-1](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/40469927/c1d8cca9-8d0e-44fd-a26a-893a7e3a0bda)

There are also other quest items that drop with no appropriate quest in quest log: Great Beak, Misthoof Hide. Maybe more.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Go to Barkskin Village in Hyjal
2. Kill one of the Barkskin clan furbolgs
3. Loot [Barkskin Pendant](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=61442).

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Item: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=61442
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40893

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
All quest items should drop only if you have a quest.
